newsitem.title: FRANCE: Sidel leads French gainers on merger news.
newsitem.headline: Sidel leads French gainers on merger news.

text.p: Shares in Sidel led the gainers on the Paris Bourse on Thursday, a day after the annnouncement of a plan to merge with Gebo Industries.
At 1025 GMT, Sidel shares were up 6.84 percent at 464.20 francs while Gebo shares were down 1.02 percent at 975 francs.
The two companies on Wednesday announced a merger through an offer of 21 Sidel shares for 10 Gebo shares.
Some nine percent of Gebo is listed following acceptance of the offer by the family of founder Pierre Schoen, with 80 percent. Staff has 11 percent of Gebo.
Analysts and traders approved the merger plan from an operational point of view but said the price offered for to Gebo minorities was on the low side.
